meanings.definition: To make someone ill or unable to do something
meanings.sent1: Eating too much candy can indispose you and make you feel sick.
meanings.sent2: The flu indisposed him, so he couldn't go to work.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to indispose his assistant by making her sneeze glitter.
meanings.sent4: The storm indisposed the hikers, leaving them stranded in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The spoiled milk indisposed my stomach, causing me discomfort.

meanings.definition: To make someone feel unwilling or reluctant to do something
meanings.sent1: The rainy weather indisposed her to go outside for a walk.
meanings.sent2: His rude behavior indisposed me to help him with his project.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected delay indisposed the team, making them lose their motivation.
meanings.sent4: The negative comments indisposed her towards attending the event.
meanings.sent5: The challenging task indisposed him to take on new responsibilities.
